articles.author: Daniel Schwarz
articles.description:
HTML lists are boring. They don’t do much, so we don’t really think about them despite how widely used they are. And we’re still able to do the same things we’ve always done to customize them, like removing markers, reversing …

articles.description:

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
What I will be doing here is kind of an experiment to explore tricks that leverage a bug with the way CSS gradients handle sub-pixel rendering to create a static noise effect — like you might see on a TV with no signal.

From Chrome 108, the following replaced elements respect the overflow property: img, video and canvas. In earlier versions of Chrome, this property was ignored on these elements.
This 
…

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pearl Akpan)
articles.description: In this guide, Pearl Akpan analyzes the methods and properties that make user interface solutions such as infinite scrolling, animating elements on scroll, or even the popular drag and drop achievable, and afterward, dives into some practical use cases for them.
articles.title: Document Object Model (DOM) Geometry: A Beginner’s Introduction And Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: Prioritizing performance when building our web apps improves the user experience and helps ensure they can be used by as many people as possible. In this article, Michelle Barker will walk you through some of the front-end optimization tips to keep our Vue apps as efficient as possible.
articles.title: Optimizing A Vue App

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cristian Díaz)
articles.description: This article is the second of two parts about a guide to making websites accessible to keyboard users. Here Cristian Diaz covers a toolset on JavaScript that you can mix into different components to create a great experience for keyboard users.
articles.title: A Guide To Keyboard Accessibility: JavaScript (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode we’re talking about User Journey Mapping. What is it, and how does it help us build better digital products? Vitaly talks to expert Stéphanie Walter to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 54 With Stéphanie Walter: What Is User Journey Mapping?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alba Silvente)
articles.description: In this article, Alba Silvente shows us the theoretical and practical solutions to the most common problems when working with images and how to automate them by using a headless CMS and an image CDN.
articles.title: A Guide To Image Optimization On Jamstack Sites

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noah Mashni and Mark Steadman)
articles.description: In this article, Noah Mashni and Mark Steadman share their approach to how to leverage the automated test results from the accessibility checks to drive change and reach sustainable digital accessibility transformation.
articles.title: Using Automated Test Results To Improve Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cristian Díaz)
articles.description: In this article, Cristian Diaz covers how to use HTML and CSS to create an accessible experience for keyboard users while mentioning what WCAG criteria we should keep into consideration.
articles.title: A Guide To Keyboard Accessibility: HTML And CSS (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrew Stetsenko)
articles.description: Working abroad is a popular prospect, yet many people — including professionals in the tech sphere — don’t know where to start. In this article, Andrew Stetsenko gives you an ultimate step-by-step guide to finding and making international opportunities happen.
articles.title: How To Search For A Developer Job Abroad

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Everything design systems on accessibility, enterprise design systems, Figma kits, data visualization, motion design, multi-lingual design, naming, ROI calculator and UX writing.
articles.title: Design Systems: Useful Examples and Resources

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Let’s talk about Next.js, one of the most well-known React frameworks used for production. From new components to font optimization, Atila shares a quick overview and invites you to join his [Advanced Next.js Masterclass](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/workshops/advanced-nextjs-atila-fassina) taking place later this month.
articles.title: What’s New In Next.js 13?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Siobhan McKeown)
articles.description: Transparency is part of the fabric of many remote businesses. It doesn’t, however, come naturally to everyone, especially if you’ve only recently become remote. In this article, Siobhan takes you through some of the practical ways that you can build transparency within your organization.
articles.title: Practical Steps To Build Transparency In Your Remote Business

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lješnjanin)
articles.description: What’s the state of HTML Email, Vue.js and Next.js? Would you like to level up with modern CSS? What are new, smart interface design patterns we could use? Let’s figure it all out together with our [brand new online workshops](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/) alongside our free community meetups.
articles.title: New Smashing Front-End & UX Workshops

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: When designing navigation on mobile, we don’t have to rely on slide-in-menus or nested accordions. We can also use the curtain design pattern, and show multiple levels of navigation at once.
articles.title: Designing The Perfect Mobile Navigation UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (William Lyon)
articles.description: If building a GraphQL API backed by a native graph database sounds interesting or at all helpful for the problems you’re trying to solve as a developer, perhaps you’d like to give the open-source [Neo4j GraphQL Library](https://srv.buysellads.com/ads/long/x/TCZPLYDDTTTTTTFR6JINCTTTTTTGVUIVKKTTTTTTCT2NTYYTTTTTTI4BVH7U4JBCKQ466IDGV2IUWESGCV7WALL5QYYE) a try. Let’s take a closer look at the reasons why!
articles.title: Putting The Graph In GraphQL With The Neo4j GraphQL Library

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: November is just around the corner, and with it, a new collection of desktop wallpapers to celebrate the beginning of the month. Designed by creatives from all across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar. Let’s make November colorful!
articles.title: On The Edge Of November (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)
